Package model.portfolio

Class SimplePortfolio

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.portfolio.SimplePortfolio
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Portfolio
    public class SimplePortfolio
extends java.lang.Object
implements Portfolio
    The SimplePortfolio object is used for allowing storage of specific stocks and quantities of those stocks. It allows for the ability to buy and sell stocks, to get the total value of the all stocks currently owned on a given date (assumes you have owned the stocks the entire time), and to get the human-readable representation of stock owned.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SimplePortfolio()
      Constructs a new SimplePortfolio object with no stocks.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimplePortfolio

        public SimplePortfolio()
        Constructs a new SimplePortfolio object with no stocks. The investments field is initialized to an empty Map. The Map is used because it allows for the ability to store the stock name and the quantity of that stock, and ensures that there are no duplicate stocks.

    • Method Detail

      • totalValue

        public double totalValue​(java.time.LocalDate date)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Portfolio
        Returns the totalValue of this portfolio on the given date. Assumes that all stocks and quantities exist on the given date.
        Specified by:
        totalValue in interface Portfolio
        Parameters:
        date - the date to find the value of all the stocks
        Returns:
        the value of all the stocks in this portfolio on the given date.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given date does not exist for any of the stocks.

      • getValue

        public double getValue​(java.lang.String stockName,
                       java.time.LocalDate date)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: Portfolio
        Gets the value of the given stock in the portfolio, on the given date. The value is based on the closing price of the given stock.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Portfolio
        Parameters:
        stockName - the name of the stock.
        date - the date that you want the value of
        Returns:
        the value of the given stock on the given date.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given stock does not exist in this portfolio or if the given date does not exist for the given stock.

        Specified by:
        sell in interface Portfolio

        amount - the amount of the stock to sell.
        Returns:
        the total value of the stock sold.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given stock does not exist, or if the given amount is greater than the quantity of the stock in this portfolio.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a human-readable representation of the stocks in the portfolio. The representation includes the stock ticker, the number of shares of that stock, and the dollar value of that stock, all formatted in a table.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Portfolio
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a human-readable representation of the stocks in the portfolio (a table of stocks owned and their values).

      • getAllShares

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllShares()

        Returns:

      • getAllValues

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllValues​(java.time.LocalDate date)
        Returns the values of all stocks owned on the specified date. If the given date is null returns the most recent price of the given stock.
        Returns:
        the total value of each stock owned on a specific date, individually listed as strings in a list.

      • addCols

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> addCols​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> col1,
                                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> col2)
        Adds two lists of String each representing a column, and add them together into an evenly spaced list representing a table with two rows (evenly spaced meaning that each String in the list will be the length of the largest String in its column, by using the string format function).
        Parameters:
        col1 - the first column, represented by a list of strings
        col2 - the second column, represented by a list of strings.
        Returns:
        a list of strings representing a formated table with two columns.
